A president who will speak to the best of who we are and challenge us to live up to our ideals. 

On Election Day, I can’t wait to vote for @JoeBiden.

2/x Yale epidemiologist: "In the future, I believe this misbegotten episode regarding hydroxychloroquine will be studied by sociologists of medicine as a classic example of how extrascientific factors overrode clearcut medical evidence." Translation: Trump hatred endangers lives.

Yale epidemiologist says hydroxychloroquine is “highly effective” on COVID: “When this inexpensive oral medication is given very early in the course of illness, before the virus has had time to multiply beyond control, it has shown to be highly effective.” https://justthenews.com/politics-policy/coronavirus/yale-epidemiologist-says-hydroxychloroquine-key-defeating-covid-19

The next 100 days will decide what kind of country we build together. We know this won't be easy. Nothing important ever is. We don’t take on this fight because it’s easy—we take on this fight because it’s right. And I'm proud to stand shoulder to shoulder with you in it.

That’s the America we can create if we stand together, if we fight together, if we persist together. That's the America we can build when we beat Donald Trump, elect @JoeBiden, and put Democrats in positions to make change all across the country.

An America where a run in with law enforcement doesn’t cost someone their life because of the color of their skin. An America where every working person—regardless of who they love, their race, gender, disability, or economic background—is paid a living wage.

We have much work ahead of us—and we will fight on because we know the America we are fighting for. An America where government is a force for good, and where decisions in Washington are made with compassion, common sense, and moral clarity.

100 days from Election Day, our country is in crisis. The fight for social, racial, and economic justice has reached a new threshold. Coronavirus is raging out of control. Unemployment is at Great Depression levels. And Trump is unable to govern at even the most elementary level.

Disability rights are civil rights.

As we commemorate the 30th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act today, we must fight to ensure that every person with a disability has the right to live in their community and has the support they need to thrive.

Congressional Republicans must end their obstruction and join Democrats to help Americans suffering from Trump’s abysmal failure on the #coronavirus. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1287407416787828736/pu/img/8QxUwLVm0kbX2y08.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1287407416787828736/pu/vid/480x270/xgUmhk2Ic3BsnJ9F.mp4?tag=10

An incredibly moving and fitting tribute for John Lewis, a man who carried the baton of justice until the very end. Today marks the 30th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act. Though we've made significant progress, we must keep working to fulfill its goals of equal opportunity, full participation, independent living, and economic self-sufficiency for all. https://twitter.com/TeamWarren/status/1287433590448566273 QT @TeamWarren "All policy issues are disability policy issues." — @ewarren #CripTheVote #ADA30 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ed3X0jlWoAAagka.jpg

For 30 years, the Americans with Disabilities Act has stood as a landmark civil rights victory. In the face of the Trump Admin’s attacks on the ADA, Democrats remain committed to defending & expanding its protections. https://www.speaker.gov/newsroom/72620 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/Ed34ieFXgAEpncb.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1287457405039763458/vid/480x270/yW_jadlrXjUqLHzj.mp4?tag=13

Today as we mark the 30th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act, we must continue the work to make sure every American is afforded the fundamental right to dignity, independence, and financial security. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/25/opinion/a-safety-net-thats-a-kafkaesque-mess.html?referringSource=articleShare

At every turn, President Trump has made matters worse for our country as we seek to fight the coronavirus. Today’s the 30th anniversary of the Americans with Disabilities Act. But many promises of the ADA remain unfulfilled. To have true equality & justice, we must expand economic opportunity for people with disabilities & build an America that is fully accessible & inclusive for all.
@RealLyndaCarter Thank you for being a shining example of a woman’s strength! Happy birthday ✨

I sent my first letter to DOJ sounding the alarm against the spread of COVID-19 in prisons way back on March 5. Make no mistake, DOJ squandered precious time to save lives—even taking days to isolate and test an inmate who was showing symptoms on March 22. https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/23/politics/california-prison-outbreak-lack-of-staffing/index.html

RT @IlhanMN There’s still time to sign up for tonight’s campaign’s Day of Action!

Help us get out the vote with a text bank — then join me for a special live stream with @BernieSanders, @JamaalBowmanNY, @RashidaTlaib, Minnesota leaders, and more:
https://go.ilhanomar.com/page/s/day-of-action

My bill to #EndCorruptionNow forces anyone who submits a study to a regulator to disclose who’s paying for it. Sham studies should be thrown out. This is a nerdy but important way to stop Big Tech & other rich & powerful corporations from rigging the rules in their favor.

Here’s what you won’t read in Big Tech's bought-and-paid-for research: Amazon, Google, Facebook & Apple have too much power over our economy, society & democracy. They think they're too big to be held accountable. We need to break up Big Tech & stop mergers that kill competition.

Big Oil funds junk research that climate change isn’t real. Wall Street peddles sham studies that banking rules hurt the economy. And Amazon & Google pay for a think tank to say Big Tech isn't too big & too powerful.

This is thinly-disguised corruption. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/24/technology/global-antitrust-institute-google-amazon-qualcomm.html

Instead of shoveling cash at our nation’s economic crisis, Congress should be focusing on a long-term recovery bill to help get our economy back on track and Americans safely back to work. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1287488240208023553/img/6T5_xe3YzpjxrG_h.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1287488240208023553/vid/480x270/PXJ7qF1MRDpP4wxR.mp4?tag=13

30 years after the Americans with Disabilities Act was signed into law, we recognize the extraordinary progress our country has made towards achieving a fully inclusive and accessible society. And we recommit to the fight ahead—because there is still more work to do.

The future of the Supreme Court. 
Economic justice for workers.
Combating the climate crisis.

All of these issues and more are on the ballot in 100 days. Register to vote at http://iwillvote.com.
